body.name: SHINESTAR Dual Fuel Stove with Butane & Propane Compatibility, Portable Camping Stove for Outdoor Cooking, Propane Adapter Hose and Carrying Case Included, 7800 BTUs Output
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 52 mins
Or fastest pickup Thursday, February 15. Order within 2 hrs 52 mins
features: 【Dual Fuel Design】Works efficiently with both 8oz. butane canisters and 1lb propane tanks. Come with adapter hose to meet all your fuel needs.

【High Heat Output】The durable aluminum single burner features a porous annular design that delivers up to 7800BTUs, boiling 4 cups of water in just 5 minutes. Save time and fuel with high-efficiency heating.
【Auto-ignition system】With a built-in automatic piezo ignition, start up easily without the need for matches or lighters. The auto-ignition is designed to ignite more than 10,000 times.

【Safe to Use】The gas stove features cartridge ejection, safety lock, and auto shut-off for secure operations when cooking or boiling. These safety features ensure secure operation and prevent accidents.

【Highly Portable】Includes black carrying case provides easy portability and storage during transportation, making it super handy for camping. The porcelain-coated grate is removable for easy cleaning.
body.description: High Versatility The gas stove is perfect for pans up to 10-inch. It is a compact and lightweight stove that is ideal for a single person or couple going camping, hiking, picnicking. Q: What's the Difference between Butane and Propane? A: An 8oz. butane canister can burn on high for about 1.25 hours. While a 1lb propane tank can last 1.5 hours on high heat. If you are going camping in winter or in a chilly area, you have to use propane over butane gas.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: High Versatility The gas stove is perfect for pans up to 10-inch. It is a compact and lightweight stove that is ideal for a single person or couple going camping, hiking, picnicking. Q: What's the Difference between Butane and Propane? A: An 8oz. butane canister can burn on high for about 1.25 hours. While a 1lb propane tank can last 1.5 hours on high heat. If you are going camping in winter or in a chilly area, you have to use propane over butane gas. Safety Tips to Follow: If you want to use propane gas, the stove can ONLY be used outdoors. Must be used on a stable and even surface to prevent falling over and creating an accident. Remove the canister when not in use to avoid butane leaks.

Cartridge Ejector Automatically eject the gas cartridge when detecting irregular pressure. Lock Lever Built-in lever won't lock unless the fuel canister is in the right position. Auto Shutoff Install in the device to cut off irregular gas flow to prevent explosion.

Windscreen Protect the blue flame and keep your food cooking at a steady temperature. Adjustable Knob Turn the dial to control the heat from a simmer to full boil. Keep in Place Long-texture grates provide stability to cooking pots.

Fuel Type Butane or Propane Ignition Type Automatic Piezo Ignition Heat Output 7800BTUs Stove Materials Cold-Rolled Iron + Aluminum Stove Sizes 13 × 11.2 × 3.5 Inches (L × W × H) Stove Weight 3.2lbs Hose Materials Rubber + Brass Hose Length 26-Inch Carrying Case Sizes 14 × 12 × 3.9 Inches (L × W × H) Total Weight 4.5lbs

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Finally !!!.....someone was smart enough to add a propane adaptor to these type stoves. Sometimes, I go camping or prospecting and have to bring the propane setup for colder weather, but it sits taller and a little unstable. I like using the Gas One model, because it has a stable platform, but, the butane doesn't work well in colder weather. Nice to be able to attach the hose, and use propane...Thanks to whoever improved upon this...Update 12/5/23. When disconnecting the propane from the stove, make sure you do it from the tank end of the hose. The propane bottle has a shut off valve that closes when you unscrew the bottle. If you try to unscrew it at the stove end, gas will leak out because there is no shut off valve at that end.Also, when moving the stove about to either change the bottle, or place it elsewhere, make sure to re-check the fitting at the stove end, and re-tighten if needed, as it comes loose a little when you move it around.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SHINESTAR Dual Fuel Stove with Butane & Propane Compatibility
reviews.reviewText: OK, first chance to test the product. Easy to install the butane cans and it started up the first attempt. I checked all connections BEFORE trying it out. I have not tried propane but feel sure it's going to be a winner. Nice blue flame with the butane. I also got a hose to attach this unit to a 20lb propane tank. I also have a few 1lb cans of propane. I didn't "USE" the product. I only tested it to be sure it would work.The case it came in was a creme color probably called white. Rather thin and the latches are rather flimsy but adequate.I'm quite sure this thing will perform as it's advertised. Flame on the very first attempt.All in all... exactly what I wanted...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I keep this on my pickup. Real handy.....stop having poor meals....make your own.....this one is a duel fuel source...bad times are here be ready !!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little stove!!
reviews.reviewText: Butane cans are impossible to find around my area, so I use only the propane feature.. (Plus propane is wayy cheaper).. and my experience has been nothing but positive. I use it as my main gas cooker in my apartment. They warn you to only use it in well ventilated areas... but that's just lawsuit prevention..The materials its made of seem no more or less flimsy than others I have owned.. They are all made to be light-weight and portable for camping and whatnot. The hose is long enough to not be a nuisance, and easily connect to a 1lb propane cylinder standing upright. The hose connections fit tight and do not leak (I'm a licensed plumber, so i know all about gas leaks)..The flame adjustment is actually better than some others that cost more. You can adjust it easily from full boil to barely a simmer, and it stays where you put it. (I have owned ones that didn't)Everything arrived un-damaged.. I'll never use the plastic case, so I cannot attest to it's durability, but I suspect it is as fragile as all the rest on the market.Overall, for the price, you really can't do better for a dual-fuel burner... I'm likely going to buy another.UPDATE: 3 months later and I'm still using it every single day.. My local Walmart finally got some butane cans in stock, so I've been using those lateley (they seem to burn hotter). This burner is performing FLAWLESSLY... You can seriously stop shopping around now... Buy this one!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not happy! Received it smashed
reviews.reviewText: I received my camping stove the day I left for a 2 month camping/roadtrip. The box was smashed, wasn't expecting the product itself to also be damaged & did not find out until after my 4 hr drive to my destination and I was completely unpacked & setup. Dinner time rolls around & I opened up the box to find the case & camp stove crushed/bent completely on one corner. The door that opens for the cylinder barely hanging on & the cylinder unable to fit in the chamber. I not only was unable to use my camp stove , but unable to make a return for a new one within the 30 days because I was out in the middle of nowhere in the middle of the forest 2-1/2 hrs from a town, with no service/internet.I was NOT about to drive to the nearest town just to make a complaint/return so I waited until I needed supplies 3 weeks later, did the formalities with explanation and pictures, but was denied & told I could not do a return.So I'm stuck with a broken unusable camp stove. 👍✔️

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Super easy to use. Works very well and hot. I love the easy start.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good multifuel stove, good value
reviews.reviewText: Needed a butane/propane camp stove and decided to try this apparently new, unrated product. Have a butane-only stove of the same design for about 25 years that worked so well inside and outside that I wanted to try the added propane option for times when butane is unavailable. Propane tanks are always around, whether smaller 1lb or the larger 20lb type (use a downsizing hose adapter, e.g. GasOne 50143-08 16.4 oz to 20 lb Tank QCC1/ Type 1, 4-12ft) so this model serves as most versatile for outdoor use. In a crunch it will work inside at home too (with good ventilation ONLY, to prevent CO poisoning) and a good backup for emergencies. Happy to have gotten this stove, though have as yet not used propane. The plastic carry case is a bit flimsy but its contents are not heavy and it serves to neatly pack the stove away. The only precaution--when new, open and air outside because burner and/or case offgas volatile organics that may not be pleasant. Wind shielding is also not included, so that would be a plus, if included.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars easy to use.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. tried it out tonight.the flames are not steadygoes super high then back to low then super high again.it will work ok in emergency situations but i wouldnt rely on this if you go camping often. i don't expect it to last long.
Perfect for when the power goes out

Works as advertised. Just make sure when using a 20lb propane tank to use the proper hose so that you get enough pressure to produce a flame. I made the mistake initially of using a propane tank hose with a built-in regulator together with an adaptor, but barely got any flame as the pressure was too down regulated. But with the proper hose, everything works fine.
